item.title: Calling Javascript from Blazor
item.description: Blazor Webassembly is a technology that allows you to write web applications in C#/.NET . But sometimes you need to call into Javascript.
item.author: christofjans@gmail.com (Christof Jans)

item.title: The proper care and disposing of one's service provider
item.description: Recently, I was working on an application which logged information to the Console. The issue I ran into is that the logging information would not always show up in the console; sometimes it would, sometimes it wouldn't.
item.author: christofjans@gmail.com (Christof Jans)
item.guid: https://blog.christofjans.com/The proper care and disposing of your service provider.html

item.title: Find the culprit with git bisect
item.description: Suppose you are developing your application, merrily committing code when suddenly you realize that a bug has been introduced. You know for sure an earlier commit was correct but the last commit is not. The bug was introduced somewhere between these 2 commits, but where?
item.author: christofjans@gmail.com (Christof Jans)

item.title: Test
item.description: This is a test post of my new "blog-engine". The world clearly does not have enough blog engines so I decided to write my own. It uses git, .NET Core and Markdown on the client and is hosted on GitHub.
item.author: christofjans@gmail.com (Christof Jans)
